item.title: Nikki add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Everything you can imagine is real." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Nikki add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "No tears in the writer, no tears in the reader. No surprise in the writer, no surprise in the reader." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Paul Gallico
item.description: "You learn eventually that, while there are no villains, there are no heroes either. And until you make the final discovery that there are only human beings, who are therefore all the more fascinating, you are liable to miss something." -- Paul Gallico

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "I like to be aware of a book as a piece of writing, and aware of its structure as a product of mind, and yet I want to be able to see the represented world through it. I admire artists who succeed in dividing my attention more or less evenly between the world of their books and the art of their books . . . so that a reader may study the work with pleasure as well as the world that it describes." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Nikki add a quote by D. H. Lawrence
item.description: "The novel is the one bright book of life. Books are not life. They are only tremulations on the ether. But the novel as a tremulation can make the whole man alive tremble." -- D. H. Lawrence

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "If you stumble about believability, what are you living for? Love is hard to believe, ask any lover. Life is hard to believe, ask any scientist. God is hard to believe, ask any believer. What is your problem with hard to believe?" -- Yann Martel

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "It all means more than I can tell you. So you must not judge what I know by what I find words for." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "The Lord is more constant and far more extravagant than it seems to imply. Wherever you turn your eyes the world can shine like transfiguration. You don't have to bring a thing to it except a little willingness to see. Only, who could have the courage to see it?" -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "Grace has a grand laughter in it." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Such squeamish youths as cannot bear to be connected with a little absurdity are not worth a regret." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "And the air was full of Thoughts and Things to Say. But at times like these, only the Small Things are ever said. Big Things lurk unsaid inside." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Muriel Barbery
item.description: "Personally I think that grammar is a way to attain beauty." -- Muriel Barbery

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Muriel Barbery
item.description: "I thought: pity the poor in spirit who know neither the enchantment nor the beauty of language." -- Muriel Barbery

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Believe that if Allah wants you to know something, someone will tell you." -- Paulo Coelho
